content.text:
# List of monuments in Ethiopia__disambig_1

This is a comprehensive list of monuments in Ethiopia, organized by region. The monuments listed here are significant for their historical and cultural importance.
Addis Ababa
{| class="wikitable" style="width:100%; border-collapse:collapse; text-align:left; font-size:14px; margin-bottom:20px;"
|-

|-
| Yekatit 12 monument || 1955 || Sidist Kilo || [https://maps.google.com/?q=9.035,38.761 9.035, 38.761] ||  || Commemorates the victims of the 1937 Italian massacre.
|-
| Monument to the Lion of Judah || 1930 || Piazza, Addis Ababa || [https://maps.google.com/?q=9.024,38.747 9.024, 38.747] ||  || Represents the Solomonic dynasty's symbolism.
|}

| Debre Berhan Selassie Church || 17th century || Gondar || [https://maps.google.com/?q=12.6075,37.473 12.6075, 37.473] ||  || Known for its unique ceiling paintings and religious significance.
|}

| Obelisk of Axum || 4th century AD || Axum || [https://maps.google.com/?q=14.121,38.724 14.121, 38.724] ||  || An ancient obelisk, one of the oldest structures in Ethiopia, returned from Italy in 2005.
|}
